data.name: Burrows-Wheeler Transform
data.description:
The Burrows-Wheeler transform is the transform used by bzip to make text easier to compress. It tends to form long runs of the same character.

You can assume the input string will be terminated by a special character "|", which will not appear elsewhere in the string.

To perform the transform, you create a table whose rows are every rotation of the input string, including the termination character. So for the input string "tutu|", then the table would be like this:

    tutu|
    |tutu
    u|tut
    tu|tu
    utu|t
    
    
You then sort these rows:

    tutu|
    tu|tu
    utu|t
    u|tut
    |tutu

Finally you take the last column, and that is your output string:
  
    |uttu

Your task is to implement this simplified version of the forward transform function `bwt`. You can assume that the input is valid and terminated properly.

All of the input strings tested are relatively short, so you are not required to provide a particularly well optimized solution.

The inverse transform `ibwt` is preloaded for your testing purposes.
